result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Miguel Bautista III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Anger management assessment and any follow thru per agent.  Any other treatment/programming per agent.  Two (2) days credit if revoked.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Miguel Bautista III

records.addlTxt:
1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan Miguel Bautista III in court.  Attorney Brent Eisberner in court for Juan Miguel Bautista III.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  State notes they are in compliance w/victim rights and VIS was filed in 22CM148 noting a request for restitution in that case but the victim has not submitted any amounts so she's asking the issue of restitution be held open in that matter.  22CF164 does have a VIS also and the Court has reviewed that.  Court questions the parties re: the names/victims.  Court reviews the CSR and parties agree w/the joint recommendation.  Court notes there has not been an arraignment in 22CF164 yet.  Court goes off the record to give DE and counsel time to discuss.  After arraignment, Court questions DE on plea agreement/voting rights/felony firearms warnings/body armor warnings.  DE pleads NC to Ct 1 in 22CF164, 22CM40 and 22CM148.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts.  DPA accepted in 22CF164 and Court finds DE guilty on Ct 1 in each of the CM cases.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 are dismissed/read-in in 22CF164.  State makes statement re: restitution - requesting hold open before the Court would schedule a restitution hearing.  Court asks that the State advise the Court w/in 60 days as to 22CM148 if they need a restitution hearing.  State makes statement re: the joint rec. in the 2 CM cases.  Atty Eisberner makes statement on behalf of the DE and the joint rec.  DE has nothing to add.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

22CF164
Ct 1:  NC - DPA for 36 months - ***ONE day credit if revoked
Cts 2, 3 & 4:  Dismissed/read-in

22CM40
Ct 1:  NC
***TWO days credit if revoked

22CM148
Ct 1:  NC

Ct 1 in each case - 24 months probation - DE to report to P&P by 3:45 pm today
Costs/surcharges of $453.00 in 22CM148 and $807.50 in 22CM40 - to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA samples to be provided
Conditions of probation:
Anger management assessment and any follow thru per agent
Any other treatment/programming per agent
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:12 pm.  Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan Miguel Bautista III in court.  Attorney Brent Eisberner in court for Juan Miguel Bautista III.  Atty Eisberner states there was an agreement reached but due to an error in paperwork they are requesting a plea/sent be reset.  Bonds continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan Miguel Bautista III in court, in custody by video from LEC.  Attorney Allison A Markoski appeared by video from LEC for Juan Miguel Bautista III.   Advised of rights to an attorney. DE will be applying for PD representation. Atty. Markoski explains non appearance, DE was in car accident.  Atty. requests signature bond. State requests reinstate signature bond.  Court reinstates $500.00 Signature bond w/same conditions.
Return date scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on May 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:02 PM Attorney Brent Eisberner in court.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Eisberner has not had any contact with DE.  Court notes the last notice was returned as undeliverable.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact w/K.N.K. or her residence

Pre-trial conference on March 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Return date on April 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:35 PM Defendant Juan Miguel Bautista in court with attorney Kathryn E Hayes.  Defendant Juan Miguel Bautista in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan Miguel Bautista appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Hayes explains nonappearance w/Ct Comm last week and provides updated address for DE.  Court notes $500 signature bond was signed in January so DE was aware of the court date.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests small cash or a signature bond and leaves that at the Court's discretion but does ask for no contact provision.  Atty Hayes responds, requests signature bond.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $500 signature bond reinstated.  Special AMENDED bond conditions as follows:  No contact with K.N.K. or her residence.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:07 PM Defendant Juan Miguel Bautista not in court.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.
